intro: Monopsis debilis var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender monopsis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is relatively rare in cultivation.
